item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Reverse-engineering and analysis of SanDisk High Endurance microSDXC card (2020) (112 points | 29 comments)
2. Show HN: Lume – OS lightweight CLI for MacOS & Linux VMs on Apple Silicon. (92 points | 16 comments)
3. Life Is More Than an Engineering Problem – Interview with Ted Chiang (129 points | 44 comments)
4. Spaced repetition can allow for infinite recall (2022) (44 points | 35 comments)
5. Analyzing the codebase of Caffeine: a high performance caching library (88 points | 8 comments)
6. Fixing Left and Mutual Recursions in Grammars (61 points | 13 comments)
7. Show HN: ESP32 RC Cars (154 points | 24 comments)
8. Fossilised fish vomit found in Denmark from sixty-six million years ago (32 points | 7 comments)
9. Show HN: Modest – musical harmony library for Lua (30 points | 4 comments)
10. Macrodata Refinement (425 points | 227 comments)
11. RLHF Book (299 points | 23 comments)
12. A Rust procedural language handler for PostgreSQL (67 points | 13 comments)
13. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (230 points | 185 comments)
14. Bzip3: A spiritual successor to BZip2 (285 points | 152 comments)
15. Pointers Are Complicated II, or: We need better language specs (2020) (128 points | 59 comments)
16. AstroForge selects target for "high risk, seat of the pants" asteroid mission (40 points | 9 comments)
17. A bookmarklet to kill sticky headers (2013) (171 points | 73 comments)
18. The Doctor Who Drank Infectious Broth and Solved a Medical Mystery (2010) (24 points | 23 comments)
19. Python 3, Pygame, and Debian Bookworm on the Miyoo A30 (137 points | 25 comments)
20. Enhancing your MIDI devices with Perl (97 points | 19 comments)
21. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (413 points | 81 comments)
22. String of recent killings linked to Bay Area 'Zizians' (512 points | 664 comments)
23. LMD: A new, less wasteful metal 3D printing technique (88 points | 23 comments)
24. I'm Ready for You: On Balzac (25 points | 3 comments)
25. The origin and unexpected evolution of the word "mainframe" (107 points | 29 comments)
26. Archivists work to save disappearing data.gov datasets (609 points | 185 comments)
27. An E-Reader Mystery (13 points | discuss)
28. A mouseless tale: trying for a keyboard-driven desktop (109 points | 61 comments)
29. CDC orders mass retraction and revision of submitted research (673 points | 416 comments)
30. Sound & Efficient Generation of DOP Exploits via Programming Language Synthesis [pdf] (11 points | discuss)
